gcci.text: H100 GPU pricing at $3.39/hr signals persistent supply chain constraints and elevated capex burdens, with limited chip availability continuing to constrain AI infrastructure scaling despite gradual production ramp-ups.

gtpi.text: Input token pricing at $1.35/1M demonstrates aggressive API price compression in the model competition landscape, forcing providers to optimize efficiency while maintaining competitive margins.

gagl.text: 150 TWh annual load represents substantial grid strain implications, with AI infrastructure's carbon footprint necessitating accelerated nuclear adoption and renewable integration for sustainable growth.

aipi.text: The convergence of high hardware costs, aggressive token pricing, and significant energy demands creates a mixed sentiment environment where growth sustainability faces pressure from operational expenses and environmental concerns.
